page.title: 05Trees in the Lenches
page.content: There are few hedges particularly in the East and often of poor quality with few hedgerow trees.The loss of the elms through Dutch Elm disease has left a serious gap but there is evidence of replanting of other deciduous trees in isolated spots. There is a deeply tree-lined approach to Sherriffs Lench and some tree clumps in the other villages. The only exotic trees are in Sheriffs Lench and Church Lench . The dominant topographical feature is the S-shaped tree covered ridge known as Bishampton Bank. There are deciduous trees at the top and a cultivated escarpment facing West.
